text:
On tap at brewery. Slightly wheats. Citrus hops. Understated but tasty. Dits easy on tongue. Nice and refreshing. 






---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Barrel & Grain for the CCB tap takeover. Cloudy yellow pour with a white head. Lemon zest aromas. Mild lemon and citrus with tasty grain, oat, and German yeast? notes. Great mouthfeel, good body, and balance. The best wheat beer Ive had to date.

Draft... Hazy light-golden ale with a small, creamy, white head. The nose is both floral and citrusy. Medium-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and middling carbonation. The flavor is certainly hoppy. This is essentially a medium-bitter American wheat ale. No sweetness and lots of citrusy bitterness. Finishes bitter and then Mojave-dry.

Draft.  Medium off-white head atop lightly hazed apple juice body, nice lacing.  Aroma is moderately sweet, orange, some grapefruit, wheat.  Taste is moderately sweet, orange, grapefruit.  Light body, quite drinkable.

A hazed blonde ale with a thin lacing off white head. In aroma, a good dose of catty hops, Nelson Sauvin, wheat base, nice and smooth. In mouth, a nice smooth crisp wheaty malt with citrusy hops, nice and balanced. On tap at brewery, Dec. 9 2012.
Good stuff. Aroma is wheat, citrus hops, and grain. Color is amber with a fluffy white head. Taste is all wheat and hops. Grainy citrus. Excellent and sessionable.

On tap at Green Room. Hazy yellow pour with a touch of orange under a nice off-white head that sticks and coats the glass. Pungent hoppy aroma with lots of bitterness, dankness, and fruitiness. Plenty of hop character in the flavor as well, again very dank and fruity. A pale, wheaty graininess lingers underneath. Not bad!
On draft at Cigar City Tap Room. Hops...they werent kidding. Struck me more as a pale ale then anything. The wheaty flavor does come through here but the hops are pretty dominating here.

Pint at the brewery. Pours a cloudy light gold. The aroma is absolutely great. There is a fresh citrus blast from the super potent hops. This hoppiness does not translate exactly in the flavor as the wheat overtakes things. There are some zesty citrus/pine notes but they battle to be noticed against the wheat. The finish is something like apricots. This was alright.
@CCB Black Friday-on tap-thin offwhite-hazy yellow/gold.  A-lemon zest, 2nd lt malt.  T-lemon/orange zest hops, 2nd lt malt/wheat-bready.  West coast wheat!

On draft at Cigar City, poured a cloudy golden yellow color with aromas of straw, light wheat, citrus, and some hops.  Flavors are light grain with some wheat, and citrus hops.  This is a little hoppy for most wheat beers that I normally enjoy, but it worked well.  Kudos to CCB.
Fairly limited notes from my phone: on tap at Proof, straw, dough, pepper, astringent, wheat, dry, 7.0

Draft at Fermentation. Hazy yellow pour with a bubbly white head. Aroma of light grainy wheat and solid amounts of citrusy hoppiness. Flavor is slightly starchy wheat grains and more fruity hops hops. Crisp medium body with a good lingering bitterness. Solid American wheat.

Pours a hazy golden yellow on tap with foamy, dissipating white head and decent lacing. Aroma of citrus from the hops and grain from the wheat. Taste is tropical citrus, hops, grainy malt, and wheat. Pretty damn good for a wheat and really easy to drink.
UPDATED: JAN 1, 2014 Tap at Cigar City. Hazy yellow pour with a white head. Awesome citrus and wheat elements, really well done in this style.
UPDATED: NOV 30, 2012 Hazy straw yellow good white head. Citrus aroma with a light wheat finish.  Taste is similar. good beer refreshing and easy to drink.

Draft to pint at Cigar City. Looks good for a wheat; a cloudy orange orange with fluffy white head. Smells and tastes solid; hoppy and doughy/wheaty. Good on the palate. Easy to drink too. An excellent example of the style.
Pours a hazy gold with a thick white head. Aroma of grapefruit, bitter hops nice and citrusy. Taste follows. Really nice

On draft at Cigar City. Pours a hazy yellow with a pillowy white head. Nose is pine, tropical fruit, grass, and bits of some peppery yeast. Flavor is similar with wheat quickly followed by pepper, big pine, some citrus, and a hoppy punch. Light to medium in body and very nice overall. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at Redlight. Hazy yellow pour with thin white head. Bright citrus tropical fruit aroma. Wheat, citrus taste, clean and tasty. Good session brew.
